info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 1:46PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Greene, northeastern Craighead, northwestern Mississippi, eastern Clay, northern Pemiscot and Dunklin Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 146 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Paragould, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paragould, Kennett, Malden, Piggott, Portageville, Hayti, Leachville, Campbell, Rector, Senath, Monette, Marmaduke, Chalk Bluff Natural Area, Clarkton, Oak Grove Heights, Cardwell, Hornersville, Holcomb, Hayti Heights and Arbyrd. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...southeastern Missouri...and western Tennessee.
